text: Jean Plannette was an American screenwriter and author active during the 1920s and 1930s. She was briefly married to RKO technician Edward L. Cox; the pair had a daughter, Elizabeth, before divorcing. == Selected filmography == * The Little Maestro (1937) * Bars and Stripes (1937) * Annie Laurie (1936) * Whispering Winds (1929) * Comrades (1928) * Outcast Souls (1928) * Polly of the Movies (1927) * Ragtime (1927) == References == Category:American women screenwriters Category:Screenwriters from Michigan Category:1905 births Category:1966 deaths Category:20th-century American women writers Category:20th-century American screenwriters
title: Jean Plannette
